Docs.param: true if the least double is desired; false otherwise
Docs.summary: Finds the least double greater than d (if positive is true), or the greatest double less than d (if positive is false).
Docs.returns: the least or greater double value

MemberSignature.Value: public override Java.Lang.Number? Parse (string? text, Java.Text.ParsePosition? status);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class Java.Lang.Number Parse(string text, class Java.Text.ParsePosition status) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Parse (text As String, status As ParsePosition) As Number
public: override Java::Lang::Number ^ Parse(System::String ^ text, Java::Text::ParsePosition ^ status);
override this.Parse : string * Java.Text.ParsePosition -> Java.Lang.Number

Docs.param: an input-output parameter. On input, the status.index field indicates the first character of the source text that should be parsed. On exit, if no error occurred, status.index is set to the first unparsed character in the source text. On exit, if an error did occur, status.index is unchanged and status.errorIndex is set to the first index of the character that caused the parse to fail.
Docs.summary: Parses a Number from the input text.
Docs.returns: A Number representing the value of the number parsed.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void SetChoices (double[]? limits, string[]? formats);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetChoices(float64[] limits, string[] formats) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub SetChoices (limits As Double(), formats As String())
public: virtual void SetChoices(cli::array <double> ^ limits, cli::array <System::String ^> ^ formats);
abstract member SetChoices : double[] * string[] -> unit override this.SetChoices : double[] * string[] -> unit

Docs.param: contains the top value that you want parsed with that format, and should be in ascending sorted order. When formatting X, the choice will be the i, where limit[i] ≤ X < limit[i+1]. If the limit array is not in ascending order, the results of formatting will be incorrect.

are the formats you want to use for each limit. They can be either Format objects or Strings. When formatting with object Y, if the object is a NumberFormat, then ((NumberFormat) Y).format(X) is called. Otherwise Y.toString() is called.
Docs.summary: Set the choices to be used in formatting.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
